newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: RUGBY UNION-LOMU SUSPENDED FOR DANGEROUS TACKLE.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-LOMU SUSPENDED FOR DANGEROUS TACKLE.

text.p: All Black winger Jonah Lomu was suspended for a week on Wednesday for a dangerous tackle and will miss the final of New Zealand's national provincial championship.
A Rugby Football Union judicial hearing imposed the ban after Lomu committed a `spear' tackle on Canterbury full-back Kieran Flynn in a match last weekend.
The giant flanker will miss Sunday's match between his Counties-Manukau side and Auckland.
